meanings.definition: A type of burial mound or barrow, often associated with ancient nomadic peoples.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologists discovered ancient kurgans in the vast desert.
meanings.sent2: The kurgans in the valley held secrets of the past civilizations.
meanings.sent3: The curious rabbit thought the kurgans were giant molehills.
meanings.sent4: The kurgans dotted the landscape like sleeping giants.
meanings.sent5: The kurgans rose like silent sentinels guarding the memories of the nomads.

meanings.definition: The plural form of kurgan, referring to multiple burial mounds or barrows.
meanings.sent1: Many kurgans were visible across the horizon, marking the ancient burial sites.
meanings.sent2: Explorers marveled at the vast expanse of kurgans stretching into the distance.
meanings.sent3: The children imagined the kurgans as hills where the ancient kings played hide and seek.
meanings.sent4: The kurgans stood like silent witnesses to the passage of time.
meanings.sent5: Legends whispered among the kurgans, sharing tales of forgotten heroes.
